564ded8c-4bd8-4715-81e5-b2863ed5d117.description: Candidates at this level can understand the main ideas of complex texts on both concrete and abstract topics, including technical discussions in their field of specialization. Can interact with a degree of fluency and spontaneity that makes regular interaction with native speakers quite possible without strain for either party. Can produce clear, detailed text on a wide range of subjects and explain a viewpoint on a topical issue giving the advantages and disadvantages of various options.
564ded8c-4bd8-4715-81e5-b2863ed5d117.name: Pearson English International Certificate Level 3

issuer.summary: issued by Pearson English Language Learning

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has completed a 4-Skill assessment of English, including Reading, Writing, Listening and Speaking The assessment was carried out under monitored and secure test conditions. Results are awarded by Pearson Edexcel.

be7c6b8e-6df7-452e-b0f3-aeaff33e6724.description: Pearson's Certified Master Trainers have demonstrated that they have the skills needed to facilitate effective, active, outcomes-driven training for adult learners. Master Trainers can create a motivating learning atmosphere, confidently communicate with participants, apply a variety of active learning and assessment techniques, and adjust instruction as needed. They have the skills needed to plan and prepare for delivering a variety of training programs and presentations.
be7c6b8e-6df7-452e-b0f3-aeaff33e6724.name: Certified Master Trainer

issuer.summary: issued by Pearson English Language Learning

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the pre-work reflection task

Achieve passing grade on both application task and reflection task

7ba36616-189b-4587-8f1a-825a9dca443b.description: Candidates at this level can understand the main points of clear standard input on familiar matters regularly encountered in work, school, leisure, etc. Can deal with most situations likely to arise while travelling in an area where the language is spoken. Can produce simple connected text on topics which are familiar or of personal interest. Can describe experiences and events, dreams, hopes and ambitions and briefly give reasons and explanations for opinions and plans.
7ba36616-189b-4587-8f1a-825a9dca443b.name: Pearson English International Certificate Level 2

9b5c6917-4407-42fa-8c79-9e928a73148b.description: Candidates at this level Can understand a wide range of demanding, longer texts and recognize implicit meaning. Can express themselves fluently and spontaneously without much obvious searching for expressions. Can use language flexibly and effectively for social, academic and professional purposes. Can produce clear, well-structured, detailed text on complex subjects, showing controlled use of organizational patterns, connectors and cohesive devices.
9b5c6917-4407-42fa-8c79-9e928a73148b.name: Pearson English International Certificate Level 4

issuer.summary: issued by Pearson English Language Learning

df22dfbd-49e6-4d5f-89dc-566071f57ce8.description: Candidates at this level can understand sentences and frequently used expressions related to areas of most immediate relevance (e.g. very basic personal and family information, shopping, local geography, employment). Can communicate in simple and routine tasks requiring a simple and direct exchange of information on familiar and routine matters. Can describe in simple terms aspects of their background, immediate environment and matters in areas of immediate need.
df22dfbd-49e6-4d5f-89dc-566071f57ce8.name: Pearson English International Certificate Level 1

aa18b64d-536b-4098-b1fd-efd3963671a2.description: In this course, learners recognize how to use persuasive language to incorporate credibility and confidence in their messages. They are engaged with 5 important tips to ensure negotiation with the right person and how to avoid tense negotiations. Topics covered include: Ingluence in Action, How to negotiate Effectively & Negotiating without conflict.
aa18b64d-536b-4098-b1fd-efd3963671a2.name: Skills for Work: Negotiating and Influencing

ef123b19-2cbb-4e4f-9546-0e24faee8c04.description: In this course , learners grow their appreciation for the different roles that exist within any team and comprehend where they fit within their team's dynamics. They also understand and increase their knowledge about active listening and why it is important to make remote working a success for them and their manager. Topics include: Teamworking, Active Listening & Working remotely.
ef123b19-2cbb-4e4f-9546-0e24faee8c04.name: Skills for Work: Teamwork

dc7431c2-3caa-435b-ab7e-67c31c3cf1b5.description: Candidates at this level can understand and use familiar everyday expressions and very basic phrases aimed at the satisfaction of needs of a concrete type. Can introduce themselves and others and can ask and answer questions about personal details such as where they live, people they know and things they have. Can interact in a simple way provided the other person talks slowly and clearly and is prepared to help.
dc7431c2-3caa-435b-ab7e-67c31c3cf1b5.name: Pearson English International Certificate Level A1

6810f5a9-ea32-41ed-b616-45b917be85c6.description: In this course, learners get acquainted to help co-workers to achieve their potential and deliver on their organisation's strategy. 241ccbad-acb1-4952-bc7a-e1c770727f5f.description: In this course, learners recognize pros and cons of a situation before making a decision. Learners also realise that successful problem solving relies on holistic thinking and learn to communicate their problems' importance to gain commitment from colleagues to ensure success.Topics covered include: Making a Decision, Critical thinking on the Fly & Problem solving Techniques for Tricky Business Challenges.
241ccbad-acb1-4952-bc7a-e1c770727f5f.name: Skills for Work: Problem Solving & Decision-making

bfc23ed4-166b-4e62-8042-aac224f10a4d.description: With this course, learners gain an understanding of techniques to release from stress by accepting personal responsibility of their performance. They identify the importance of development feedback to focus on clear goals and avoid distraction to continue with performance improvement. Also, they are presented strategies for time management that can contribute to their organizational skills development. Topics include: Managing your time, Dealing with Stress & How to get the best out of you.
bfc23ed4-166b-4e62-8042-aac224f10a4d.name: Skills for Work: Self-management

a79d1cfd-55fc-4894-b08d-682bd84b981f.description: Participants in the course have demonstrated that they have acquired the knowledge pertaining to running a preparation course for Pearson English International Certificate computer-based test. 0331507c-07be-4dd6-bbf0-cde8327c5c7f.description: In this course, learners understand strategies to control their emotions, recognise and detect others' emotions. They identify the five 'domains' of emotional intelligence as outlined by respected psychologist Daniel Goleman. Topics covered include: Emotional Intelligence - Perceiving Emotions and Emotional intelligence essentials.
0331507c-07be-4dd6-bbf0-cde8327c5c7f.name: Skills for Work: Adaptability

716d60e2-b32f-4240-826f-dae830060d8d.description: In this course, learners learn how to build a longer lasting relationship with their customers by adopting a customer-driven approach which focuses on value, engagement and loyalty. They also learn how to do basic market analysis and find information on competitors to boost awareness with customers. Topics covered include: How to be customer driven, Businesss and Customer Awareness & Competitive and Market analysis.
716d60e2-b32f-4240-826f-dae830060d8d.name: Skills for Work: Commercial Awareness

d8ea3f51-d7ae-4fa6-8de8-3086ab7995e5.description: Through this course, learners identify the necessary elements to achieve effectiveness being proactive. They will also learn the SMART metodology to realise how their personal goals are different to their organisations'. At the end of the course they can to establish short and long term personal goals with 4 useful tips. Topics covered include: Setting SMART objectives, Secrets of High Performance, Setting Personal Goals & 6 ways to Progress Your Career.
d8ea3f51-d7ae-4fa6-8de8-3086ab7995e5.name: Skills for Work: Managing Own Personal Performance

2d1a0772-015e-41b7-aa9d-6dd75c0450ba.description: In this course, learners are presented with strategies on how to communicate with empathy and confidence and to use an array of body language techniques. Topics covered include: Communicating Confidently with Empathy, Body Language - First Impressions & Writing effective emails.
2d1a0772-015e-41b7-aa9d-6dd75c0450ba.name: Skills for Work: Professionalism

7f6c02f3-4596-4a97-b5d9-6a664fd12ae0.description: In this course learners familiarize with some strategies for developing resilience to handle pressure and deal with setbacks.
